FuncDef:
The process-pst command enables a BFD session to modify the port state table or link state table upon detection of a fault.
The undo process-pst command disables a BFD session from modifying the port state table or link state table upon detection of a fault. The process-pst command enables a BFD session to modify the port state table or link state table upon detection of a fault. The undo process-pst command disables a BFD session from modifying the port state table or link state table upon detection of a fault. By default, a BFD session does not modify the port state table or link state table upon detection of a fault. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ExtraInfo: In BFD-based link protection scenarios, you are advised to run the process-pst command to enable a BFD session to modify the port state table or link state table upon detection of a fault so that a fast link switchover can be performed.
